result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R O'Brien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and work search granted for counseling and treatment.
14 days jail credit if Probation is revoked.
Consecutive to: Case No. 16CM28.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to Probation within 48 hours of release.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

records.addlTxt:
(Clerked by DNeva)
Defendant Jonathan R O'Brien in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CM134 State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants.

16CM28 Defendant pleads guilty to bail jumping.  Court questions and finds guilty.
Court orders:
Imposed and stayed 30 days jail.
Huber and work search granted for counseling and treatment.
Probation 2 years.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Court costs and DNA Surcharge.
Any evals and counseling recommended by probation.

16CM121 Defendant pleads guilty to bail jumping.  Court questions and finds guilty.
Court orders:
Imposed and stayed 30 days jail consecutive to 16CM28 credit for 14 days if revoked.
Huber and work search granted for counseling and treatment.
Probation 2 years.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Court costs and DNA Surcharge.
Any evals and counseling recommended by probation.

$100.00 previously posted will be applied to costs.

Must report to probation within 48 hours of release.

Order to submit DNA Specimen form given to defendant.  Must submit before release.

Faxed to jail.
Application and Order for Return of Bond

BOND COVERS 16CM121 and 16CM134
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must submit to daily PBTs at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 AM and 6:00 PM.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

16CM134 Qualifies for Public Defender.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court questions State regarding request to revoke bond in 16CM121 - State does not object to bond money being returned.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
